What is an ocean?
- An ocean is a very large body of salt water that covers most of the Earth. All the oceans together are sometimes called the “World Ocean.”

Quick facts

- Atlantic Ocean: about 106 million square kilometers (about 41.1 million square miles).

- The Atlantic is the second-largest ocean and connects the Arctic in the north to the Southern Ocean in the south.

Quick question (try this!)
- If the Atlantic were one big pizza, how many pizzas would you need to match the Pacific? (Answer: about 1 and 1/2 pizzas!)

- Ocean sizes are measured by scientists and reported by places like NOAA and National Geographic. The numbers above are rounded to make them easy to understand.
